info.title: Elorus Developer API
info.description:
The Elorus Developer API allows external applications to access and 
update organization data on the [Elorus platform](https://www.elorus.com) 
programmatically. With the API, you can:

- Update data without using the Elorus user interface
- Integrate your e-shop or website to automate invoicing and synchronize data
- Connect your project management or productivity tools with Elorus 
to track hours worked
- Use Elorus as your billing system

This portal provides comprehensive documentation for developers to 
interact with and utilize the Elorus API.

API key.name: Authorization
API key.description:
To connect to the API one must be registered with Elorus and own an 
**API key**. The API key is bound to a specific user, and therefore
 can be used to perform any action the user can perform within Elorus.

The *API key* must be sent on every request through the standard 
`Authorization` HTTP header as follows:

    Authorization: Token <the_token>

<u>To find your *API key* open the Elorus web application and navigate to the "User Profile".</u>

get.description:
Get the list of bills.
---
The response does not include all the bill details.
To retrieve more information about a specific bill, use
the [single bill](#operation/bills_read) endpoint.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `branch__branch_name`, `supplier__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `due_date`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `supplier__display_name`, `supplier__vat_number`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence_flat`, `reference`, `items__product__title`, `items__product__code`, `items__description`, `related_notes__notes`, `custom_id`.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the document's status.  The available choices are: `draft`, `pending`, `issued`, `partial`, `unpaid`, `overdue`, `paid`, `void`.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: pending_approval
parameters.description: Optionally filter by pending status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: overdue
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is overdue or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: Optionally filter by supplier ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: self_billed
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the document is self-billed or not. Can be either `1` or `0`. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: custom_id
parameters.description: Optionally filter by custom ID.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: created_period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100. The maximum allowed value is 250.

parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

post.description:
Create a new bill.
---
To create a new bill, you must first specify the supplier.
If you do not specify the currency code, the supplier's
default currency will have a higher priority than your base currency.

#### Bill lines & amounts
The bill's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the bill lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

Remember that if you do not care about the bill details,
you can always just send the total amounts in a single line.

put.description:
Update a bill.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft bills. To
update issued bills, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/bills_partial_update).

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/bills_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a bill.
---
Since this method does not modify the line items
and amounts you can always use it regardless the bill status.
On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/bills_update) is only applicable
to draft bills.

Please note that you cannot mark void bills as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/bills_mark_void) them first.

get.description:
Email the document to a client.
---
You may retrieve the default email subject, message etc. with a `GET`
request. Use the `POST` request to queue the email for sending.
In most cases you want to send the data exactly as returned by
the `GET` action.

put.description:
Mark the document as void or convert it from "void" back to "issued".

Notice that when you mark a document as void:

* It must already be issued.
* It remains in the system for future reference, but is not involved in Elorus reports.
* The sign "Void" appears for both the document entry inside the system and the printable version of it.

post.description:
Create a new payment sent.
---
Whenever you send money to suppliers or clients
(e.g., to pay a supplier invoice), you can create a “Payment sent”
record to represent the transaction. Payments sent are
divided into three types:

* Supplier Payment
* Client Refund
* Other payment

get.description:
Get the list of payments received.
---
The response does not include all the payments received details.
To retrieve more information about a specific payment received,
use the single payments received endpoint.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `amount`, `branch__branch_name`, `contact__display_name`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `title`, `contact__display_name`, `date`, `contact__vat_number`, `related_notes__notes`, `custom_id`.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: pending_approval
parameters.description: Optionally filter by pending status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Optionally filter by transaction type. Either `dp`, `ip` or `cnp`

parameters.name: invoice
parameters.description: Optionally filter by invoice ID.

parameters.name: purchasecreditnote
parameters.description: Optionally filter by supplier credit ID.

parameters.name: custom_id
parameters.description: Optionally filter by custom ID.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

post.description:
Create a new credit note.
---
To create a new credit note, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
As far as the PDF rendering is concerned, you must first specify
the template to use. You may override `terms` and `public_notes`
template settings through their separate fields.

#### Credit note lines & amounts
The credit note's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the credit note lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

put.description:
Update a credit note.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft credit notes. To
update issued creditnotes, you should first mark them as draft via the
[partial update endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_partial_update).

When changing the credit note client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

patch.description:
Partially update a credit note.
---
Use this action to update the credit note tracking,
or change it's draft status. Since this method does
not modify the credit note items and amounts you can always use it
regardless the creditnote status. On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/invoices_update) is only applicable
to draft credit notes.

Please note that you cannot mark void credit notes as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/creditnotes_mark_void) them first.

When changing the delivery note contact,
all contact fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/deliverynotes_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

post.description:
Create a new estimate.
---
To create a new estimate, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
You may specify the template to use when rendering the estimate to PDF.
If you omit the `template` field, the client's default template will
be used.

#### Invoice lines & amounts
The estimate's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the estimate lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.

post.description:
Create a new invoice.
---
To create a new invoice, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
You may specify the template to use when rendering the invoice to PDF.
If you omit the `template` field, the client's default template will
be used.

#### Invoice lines & amounts
The invoice's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the invoice lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.

#### Payment gateways
When you create a new invoice, it will be automatically associated
with the default [payment gateways](#tag/paymentgateways) of the
organization (if any), so that the invoice can be paid online.
To modify the invoice's payment gateways, you must use
the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

put.description:
Update an invoice.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft invoices. To
update issued invoices, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

When changing the invoice client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/invoices_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

patch.description:
Partially update an invoice.
---
Use this action to update the invoice payment gateways, tracking,
or change it's draft status. Since this method does
not modify the invoice items and amounts you can always use it
regardless the invoice status. On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/invoices_update) is only applicable
to draft invoices.

Please note that you cannot mark void invoices as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/invoices_mark_void) them first.

post.description:
Create a new recurring invoice.
---
You must specify the
[recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) as well as the details
of the generated invoices. As far as the schedule is concerned,
you may leave the `end_datetime` field blank to run the recurring
procedure forever.

To better understand how the invoice fields work, you might want
to have a look at the
[invoice's create endpoint](#operation/invoices_create) as well.

put.description:
When changing the invoice client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/recurringinvoices_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

get.description:
Get the list of supplier credits.
---
The response does not include all the supplier credit details.
To retrieve more information about a specific record, use the
[single supplier credit](#operation/purchasecreditnotes_read)
endpoint.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `branch__branch_name`, `supplier__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `supplier__display_name`, `supplier__vat_number`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence_flat`, `reference`, `items__product__title`, `items__product__code`, `items__description`, `related_notes__notes`, `custom_id`.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the document's status.  The available choices are: `draft`, `pending`, `issued`, `partial`, `unpaid`, `paid`, `void`.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: pending_approval
parameters.description: Optionally filter by pending status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: Optionally filter by supplier ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: self_billed
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the document is self-billed or not. Can be either `1` or `0`. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: custom_id
parameters.description: Optionally filter by custom ID.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

parameters.name: created_period
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date period. Date period must be one of the following constants: `today`,`current_week`, `current_month`, `current_year`, `last_week`, `last_month`, `last_year` or in the form of this template last_`<integer>`_`<(days, weeks, months, years)>`

put.description:
Mark the document as void or convert it from "void" back to "issued".

Notice that when you mark a document as void:

* It must already be issued.
* It remains in the system for future reference, but is not involved in Elorus reports.
* The sign "Void" appears for both the document entry inside the system and the printable version of it.

get.description:
Get the list of organization users.
---
This endpoint is designed to facilitate interaction with other
sections of the API, such as [projects](#tag/projects),
where project members are identified by their corresponding user ID.

Access to the user list is granted to admin users, users with
project editing permissions, or users who are members of at least
one project and hold manager rights for that specific project.

custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
pendingPending approval
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: Optionally, associate the record with a document type to denote the type of the received document. This field is required in case of a self-billed document.

self_billed.title: Self-billed invoice
self_billed.description: Denotes whether this is a self-billed invoice. This value is auto-generated and depends on the bill's document type.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference code. Usually, the document number as specified by the supplier.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

permalink.title: Permalink
permalink.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. Public URL for clients.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

country.title: Country
country.description:
One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription

branch_code.title: Branch code
branch_code.description: Applies only to organizations based in Greece. When the counterpart has multiple branches, you may specify the branch code to use when uploading this record to myDATA. Leave empty or use '0' to denote the business headquarters.

contact_display_name.title: Contact name
contact_display_name.description: The entity's display name, as it will appear on the PDF.

type.title: Entity role
type.description:
The entity's role in transport. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
3Transporter
4Recipient of the Sender (Seller)
5Sender (Seller)
6Other Correlated Entity

PurchaseItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
PurchaseItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Unit of measurement
unit_measure.description:
The `symbol` of the corresponding unit of measurement. You may use the symbol of any custom unit, however the following options are always available:
ValueDescription
itemItem
serviceService
mm2Square millimetre
cm2Square centimetre
m2Square metre
km2Square kilometre
mmMillimetre
cmCentimetre
mMetre
kmKilometre
mlMillilitre
lLitre
mgMilligram
grGram
kgKilogram
tTon
minuteMinute
hourHour
monthMonth
yearYear
man-hourMan-Hour
man-dayMan-Day
man-monthMan-Month
kilowatt-hourKilowatt hour
packagePackage
boxBox
m3Cubic metre
dayDay

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

unit_discount_mode.title: Discount value mode
unit_discount_mode.description:
How the discount value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
amountAmount

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

billable.title: Billable
billable.description: If the line is associated with a project, you may bill the expense to your client the next time you invoice the project.

expense_category.title: Expense category
expense_category.description: ID of the associated expense category.

taric_code.title: Taric Code
taric_code.description: The TARIC code (TARif Intégré Communautaire; Integrated Tariff of the European Communities) is designed to show the various rules applying to specific products when imported into the EU.

PurchaseStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
PurchaseStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

PurchaseWithholdingTaxNested.title: Withholding taxes
PurchaseWithholdingTaxNested.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The amount is being automatically calculated, unless the associated tax is is a variable amount tax (the tax's `value_mode` is set to `dynamic`). In this case you must specify the tax amount yourself. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description:
Set this field to a value other than `0`, to denote that a subtotal should be calculated. As a result, all subsequent withholding taxes (the taxes that follow in the list)will be calculated over this subtotal, rather than the document's net amount. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0No subtotal
1Progressive up until this tax
2Includes this tax only

RecordTrackingCategoryNested.title: Tracking categories
RecordTrackingCategoryNested.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

trackingcategory.title: Trackingcategory
trackingcategory.description: ID of the associated tracking category.

option.title: Option
option.description: The selected option of the tracking category.

custom_id.title: Custom ID
custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
pendingPending approval
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: Optionally, associate the record with a document type to denote the type of the received document. This field is required in case of a self-billed document.

self_billed.title: Self-billed invoice
self_billed.description: Denotes whether this is a self-billed invoice. This value is auto-generated and depends on the bill's document type.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference code. Usually, the document number as specified by the supplier.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

due_days.title: Due days
due_days.description: Days after the issue date, that the invoice will be considered overdue. This affects the document's due date. Use `null` to not set a due date.

supplier_display_name.title: Supplier name
supplier_display_name.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier name as it will appear on the PDF.

supplier_profession.title: Supplier profession
supplier_profession.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier profession, as it will appear on the PDF.

supplier_contact_person.title: Contact person
supplier_contact_person.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier's contact person, as it will appear on the PDF.

supplier_phone_number.title: Phone number
supplier_phone_number.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier phone number, as it will appear on the PDF.

supplier_email.title: Email
supplier_email.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier email address, as it will appear on the PDF.

dispatch_date.title: Dispatch date
dispatch_date.description: Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

move_purpose.title: Move purpose
move_purpose.description:
One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Sale
2Sales on Behalf of Third Parties
3Sampling
4Exhibition
5Return
7Edit - Assembly - Disassembly
8Intra-transfer (Between Entity Branches)
9Purchase
10Provision of Ships and Aircraft
11Free Disposal
12Warranty
13Lending
14Storage by Third Parties
19Other Transport
20Express delivery

related_documents.description: A list of purchase IDs linked to this document.

items.title: Related documents
items.description: A list of purchase IDs linked to this document.

currency_code.title: Currency
currency_code.description:
If not specified, this is set to the contact's default currency code if it exists. In other case the organization's base currency code is used. One of the following:

initialTax exclusive

items.description: Line items of a bill.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions and dictates how amounts will be calculated if there exist associated taxes. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

net.title: Total value
net.description: Applies only to "Income" transactions and shows the de-taxed amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
activeIssued
pendingPending approval
voidVoid

invoice_payments.description: A list of the invoices paid via this transaction. Applies to "Client payment" transactions.

purchasecreditnote_payments.description: A list of the purchase credit notes paid via this transaction. Applies to "Supplier refund" transactions.

created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions and dictates how amounts will be calculated if there exist associated taxes. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

net.title: Total value
net.description: Applies only to "Income" transactions and shows the de-taxed amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

invoice_payments.description: A list of the invoices paid via this transaction. Applies to "Client payment" transactions.

purchasecreditnote_payments.description: A list of the purchase credit notes paid via this transaction. Applies to "Supplier refund" transactions.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

CreditNoteItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
CreditNoteItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Unit of measurement
unit_measure.description:
The `symbol` of the corresponding unit of measurement. You may use the symbol of any custom unit, however the following options are always available:
ValueDescription
itemItem
serviceService
mm2Square millimetre
cm2Square centimetre
m2Square metre
km2Square kilometre
mmMillimetre
cmCentimetre
mMetre
kmKilometre
mlMillilitre
lLitre
mgMilligram
grGram
kgKilogram
tTon
minuteMinute
hourHour
monthMonth
yearYear
man-hourMan-Hour
man-dayMan-Day
man-monthMan-Month
kilowatt-hourKilowatt hour
packagePackage
boxBox
m3Cubic metre
dayDay

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

unit_discount_mode.title: Discount value mode
unit_discount_mode.description:
How the discount value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
amountAmount

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taric_code.title: Taric Code
taric_code.description: The TARIC code (TARif Intégré Communautaire; Integrated Tariff of the European Communities) is designed to show the various rules applying to specific products when imported into the EU.

CreditNoteStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
CreditNoteStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

CreditNoteWithholdingTaxNested.title: Withholding taxes
CreditNoteWithholdingTaxNested.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The amount is being automatically calculated, unless the associated tax is is a variable amount tax (the tax's `value_mode` is set to `dynamic`). In this case you must specify the tax amount yourself. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description:
Set this field to a value other than `0`, to denote that a subtotal should be calculated. As a result, all subsequent withholding taxes (the taxes that follow in the list)will be calculated over this subtotal, rather than the document's net amount. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0No subtotal
1Progressive up until this tax
2Includes this tax only

payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values

initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of a delivery note.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: ID of the associated document type.

number.title: Number
number.description: Use empty string or do not send it at all, for automatic numbering.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

client_display_name.title: Client name
client_display_name.description: The client name as it will appear on the PDF.

client_profession.title: Client profession

client_vat_number.title: Client tax ID
client_vat_number.description: The client tax ID, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_phone_number.title: Phone number
client_phone_number.description: The client phone number, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_email.title: Email
client_email.description: The client email address, as it will appear on the PDF.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

converted_invoice.title: Converted invoice
converted_invoice.description: The ID of the generated invoice (if any).

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

EstimateItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
EstimateItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Unit of measurement
unit_measure.description:
The `symbol` of the corresponding unit of measurement. You may use the symbol of any custom unit, however the following options are always available:
ValueDescription
itemItem
serviceService
mm2Square millimetre
cm2Square centimetre
m2Square metre
km2Square kilometre
mmMillimetre
cmCentimetre
mMetre
kmKilometre
mlMillilitre
lLitre
mgMilligram
grGram
kgKilogram
tTon
minuteMinute
hourHour
monthMonth
yearYear
man-hourMan-Hour
man-dayMan-Day
man-monthMan-Month
kilowatt-hourKilowatt hour
packagePackage
boxBox
m3Cubic metre
dayDay

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

EstimateStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
EstimateStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

ExpenseItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
ExpenseItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

expense_category.title: Expense category
expense_category.description: ID of the associated expense category.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Used in both "initial" and  "total" calculation modes. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

billable.title: Billable
billable.description: If the line is associated with a project, you may bill the expense to your client the next time you invoice the project.

ExpenseStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
ExpenseStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

custom_id.title: Custom ID
custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference code. Usually, the document number as specified by the supplier.
