exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

InvoiceItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
InvoiceItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Unit of measurement
unit_measure.description:
The `symbol` of the corresponding unit of measurement. You may use the symbol of any custom unit, however the following options are always available:
ValueDescription
itemItem
serviceService
mm2Square millimetre
cm2Square centimetre
m2Square metre
km2Square kilometre
mmMillimetre
cmCentimetre
mMetre
kmKilometre
mlMillilitre
lLitre
mgMilligram
grGram
kgKilogram
tTon
minuteMinute
hourHour
monthMonth
yearYear
man-hourMan-Hour
man-dayMan-Day
man-monthMan-Month
kilowatt-hourKilowatt hour
packagePackage
boxBox
m3Cubic metre
dayDay

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

unit_discount_mode.title: Discount value mode
unit_discount_mode.description:
How the discount value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
amountAmount

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taric_code.title: Taric Code
taric_code.description: The TARIC code (TARif Intégré Communautaire; Integrated Tariff of the European Communities) is designed to show the various rules applying to specific products when imported into the EU.

InvoiceStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
InvoiceStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

InvoiceWithholdingTaxNested.title: Withholding taxes
InvoiceWithholdingTaxNested.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The amount is being automatically calculated, unless the associated tax is is a variable amount tax (the tax's `value_mode` is set to `dynamic`). In this case you must specify the tax amount yourself. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description:
Set this field to a value other than `0`, to denote that a subtotal should be calculated. As a result, all subsequent withholding taxes (the taxes that follow in the list)will be calculated over this subtotal, rather than the document's net amount. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0No subtotal
1Progressive up until this tax
2Includes this tax only

InvoiceRelatedEntities.description: Additional parties involved in the transport. This field applies only to documents that include transport information (i.e., when the `is_delivery_note` property of the corresponding document type is set to `true`)

contact_display_name.title: Contact name
contact_display_name.description: The entity's display name, as it will appear on the PDF.

type.title: Entity role
type.description:
The entity's role in transport. One of the following:

4Recipient of the Sender (Seller)
5Sender (Seller)
6Other Correlated Entity

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

template.title: Template
template.description: ID of the associated template.

terms.title: Terms & conditions
terms.description: These terms are displayed on the document's printable form.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.

sales.title: Sales
sales.description: Indicates if you sale this item or not.

sale_value.title: Sale value
sale_value.description: Default unit sale value (this is not currency-agnostic). Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

items.title: Purchase taxes
items.description: A list of tax IDs that should apply by default when purchasing the item.

manage.title: Manage stock
manage.description: Whether Elorus should manage the product's stock.

stock.title: Stock number
stock.description: The initial stock. Applies only to products having stock management enabled. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

V12ProjectMemberNestedList.title: Project members
V12ProjectMemberNestedList.description: A list of the project members. In order to track time for a project, a user must be added to the project member list.

hourly_rate.title: Hourly rate
hourly_rate.description: The hourly rate for this specific user. Applies only to projects whose billing method is set to "Assignee hourly rate".

cost_per_hour.title: Cost per hour
cost_per_hour.description: The hourly cost of this specific user.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description, used for your own reference.

billing_method.title: Billing method
billing_method.description:
The formula used to calculate project revenues based on tracked hours. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
fixed_costFixed cost
project_rateHourly rate
task_rateTask hourly rate
assignee_rateAssignee hourly rate
non_billableNon billable

fixed_cost.title: Fixed cost
fixed_cost.description: A fixed rate for the entire project. Applies only to projects whose billing method is set to "Fixed cost".

hourly_rate.title: Hourly rate
hourly_rate.description: The hourly rate of the project. Applies only to projects whose billing method is set to "Hourly rate".

active.title: Active
active.description: Instead of deleting, you may archive the record.

members.description: A list of the project members. In order to track time for a project, a user must be added to the project member list.

client_portal.title: Client portal
client_portal.description:
Show or hide the project in the client portal. For this setting to take effect, the client must have access to the client portal. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
allShow all time entries
billableShow billable time entries
hideHide project

manager.title: Manager
manager.description: Whether the user can manage the project or not. You may manually set this field only for users whose role within the organization is "Project Manager" or for those assigned a custom role with the "Edit Project" permission set to "Only projects they manage." For all other users, this property is automatically calculated.

fixed_cost.title: Fixed cost
fixed_cost.description: A fixed rate for the entire project. Applies only to projects whose billing method is set to "Fixed cost".

hourly_rate.title: Hourly rate
hourly_rate.description: The hourly rate of the project. Applies only to projects whose billing method is set to "Hourly rate".

billed_amount.title: Billed amount
billed_amount.description: The total billed amount for the project is calculated based on the actual amounts from the associated invoices and credit notes.

expenses_amount.title: Expenses amount
expenses_amount.description: The total project expenses, calculated based on the associated expenses, bills, and supplier credit notes.

unbilled_expenses_amount.title: Unbilled expenses amount
unbilled_expenses_amount.description: The total unbilled expenses for the project.

unbilled_hours_amount.title: Unbilled hours amount
unbilled_hours_amount.description: The total unbilled amount for the project, corresponding to the unbilled hours.

costs.title: Costs
costs.description: The total costs represent the labor costs incurred by the organization as a result of the project. These costs are calculated based on the hourly rate of each project member who has tracked time for the project.

billable_hours.title: Billable hours
billable_hours.description: The total billable hours for the project.

total_hours.title: Total hours
total_hours.description: The total tracked hours for the project. Ongoing time entries are not taken into consideration.

unbilled_hours.title: Unbilled hours
unbilled_hours.description: The total unbilled hours for the project.

unbilled_extra_fees_amount.title: Unbilled extra fees amount
unbilled_extra_fees_amount.description: The total unbilled amount for the project's non-invoiced extra fees.

members.description: A list of the project members. In order to track time for a project, a user must be added to the project member list.

custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

start_datetime.title: Start date
start_datetime.description: When should the first invoice be created. Timezone information is included.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: The recurring frequency's interval. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information.

period.title: Period
period.description:
The recurring frequency's period. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
daysDays
weeksWeeks
monthsMonths

end_datetime.title: End date
end_datetime.description: When should the last invoice be created. A maximum of 60 executions is allowed. Timezone information is included.

last_execution.title: Last execution
last_execution.description: When was the last invoice created. Automatically calculated datetime. Timezone information is included.

next_execution.title: Next execution
next_execution.description: When will the next invoice be created. Automatically calculated datetime.

paused.title: Paused
paused.description: While the record is paused new records will not be created.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: ID of the associated document type.

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: Whether the generated documents will be in draft mode.

auto_email.title: Email created invoices to the client
auto_email.description: Email issued invoices to the client. Draft field needs to be false.

auto_email_attach_pdf.title: Attach the invoice PDF to the email message
auto_email_attach_pdf.description: This option is available when the `auto_email` option is enabled.

due_days.title: Due days
due_days.description: Days after the issue date, that a commercial document will be considered overdue. This affects the commercial document's due date. You may leave the field blank if you do not want to apply credit.

template.title: Template
template.description: ID of the template that will be used to render the created invoices.

client_profession.title: Client profession
client_profession.description: The client profession, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_vat_number.title: Client tax ID
client_vat_number.description: The client tax ID, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_contact_person.title: Contact person
client_contact_person.description: The client's contact person, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_phone_number.title: Phone number
client_phone_number.description: The client phone number, as it will appear on the PDF.

client_email.title: Email
client_email.description: The client email address, as it will appear on the PDF.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

RecurringInvoiceItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
RecurringInvoiceItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.title: Title
title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Unit of measurement
unit_measure.description:
The `symbol` of the corresponding unit of measurement. You may use the symbol of any custom unit, however the following options are always available:
ValueDescription
itemItem
serviceService
mm2Square millimetre
cm2Square centimetre
m2Square metre
km2Square kilometre
mmMillimetre
cmCentimetre
mMetre
kmKilometre
mlMillilitre
lLitre
mgMilligram
grGram
kgKilogram
tTon
minuteMinute
hourHour
monthMonth
yearYear
man-hourMan-Hour
man-dayMan-Day
man-monthMan-Month
kilowatt-hourKilowatt hour
packagePackage
boxBox
m3Cubic metre
dayDay

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

unit_discount_mode.title: Discount value mode
unit_discount_mode.description:
How the discount value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
amountAmount

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

RecurringInvoiceStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
RecurringInvoiceStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

RecurringInvoiceWithholdingTaxNested.title: Withholding taxes
RecurringInvoiceWithholdingTaxNested.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The amount is being automatically calculated, unless the associated tax is is a variable amount tax (the tax's `value_mode` is set to `dynamic`). In this case you must specify the tax amount yourself. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description:
Set this field to a value other than `0`, to denote that a subtotal should be calculated. As a result, all subsequent withholding taxes (the taxes that follow in the list)will be calculated over this subtotal, rather than the document's net amount. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0No subtotal
1Progressive up until this tax
2Includes this tax only

custom_id.title: Custom ID
custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

start_datetime.title: Start date
start_datetime.description: When should the first invoice be created. Timezone information is included.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: The recurring frequency's interval. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information.

period.title: Period
period.description:
The recurring frequency's period. Please see the [recurring schedule](#tag/recurringinvoices) for more information. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
daysDays
weeksWeeks
monthsMonths

end_datetime.title: End date
end_datetime.description: When should the last invoice be created. A maximum of 60 executions is allowed. Timezone information is included.

last_execution.title: Last execution
last_execution.description: When was the last invoice created. Automatically calculated datetime. Timezone information is included.

next_execution.title: Next execution
next_execution.description: When will the next invoice be created. Automatically calculated datetime.

paused.title: Paused
paused.description: While the record is paused new records will not be created.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: ID of the associated document type.

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: Whether the generated documents will be in draft mode.

auto_email.title: Email created invoices to the client
auto_email.description: Email issued invoices to the client. Draft field needs to be false.

auto_email_attach_pdf.title: Attach the invoice PDF to the email message
auto_email_attach_pdf.description: This option is available when the `auto_email` option is enabled.

due_days.title: Due days
due_days.description: Days after the issue date, that a commercial document will be considered overdue. This affects the commercial document's due date. You may leave the field blank if you do not want to apply credit.

template.title: Template
template.description: ID of the template that will be used to render the created invoices.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of an invoice.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

custom_id.description: Assign a custom ID for easier identification and integration with external systems. This field is optional and can be used to reference records according to your own internal identifiers.

PurchaseCreditNoteItemTaxNested.title: Taxes
PurchaseCreditNoteItemTaxNested.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_amount.title: VAT amount
vat_amount.description: In case the tax is subject to VAT, the VAT amount is typically automatically calculated and returned in this field. However, if `auto_calculate_vat` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the VAT amount. If `auto_calculate_vat` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

auto_calculate_vat.title: Calculate VAT amount automatically
auto_calculate_vat.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `vat_amount` property to manually set the VAT amount.

V12PurchaseCreditNoteItemNestedCreate.title: Line items
V12PurchaseCreditNoteItemNestedCreate.description: Line items of a supplier credit.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.description:

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount_percentage.title: Discount percentage
unit_discount_percentage.description: Percentage, not absolute value. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

unit_discount_mode.title: Discount value mode
unit_discount_mode.description:
How the discount value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
amountAmount

taxes.description: A list of taxes that apply to this line.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

expense_category.title: Expense category
expense_category.description: ID of the associated expense category.

PurchaseCreditNoteStandardTaxNested.title: Taxes
PurchaseCreditNoteStandardTaxNested.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

auto_calculate.title: Calculate automatically
auto_calculate.description: By default, Elorus performs calculations automatically. You can use this field to disable automatic calculations and then use the `amount` property to manually set the tax amount. If the tax is applied at the line level (i.e., included in a line’s `taxes` field), this setting is ignored, as the tax amount will be calculated based on the line totals.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The tax amount is typically calculated automatically. However, if `auto_calculate` is set to `False`, you can use this field to specify the tax amount. If `auto_calculate` is `True`, this field will be ignored. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

PurchaseCreditNoteWithholdingTaxNested.title: Withholding taxes
PurchaseCreditNoteWithholdingTaxNested.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

amount.title: Tax amount
amount.description: The amount is being automatically calculated, unless the associated tax is is a variable amount tax (the tax's `value_mode` is set to `dynamic`). In this case you must specify the tax amount yourself. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description:
Set this field to a value other than `0`, to denote that a subtotal should be calculated. As a result, all subsequent withholding taxes (the taxes that follow in the list)will be calculated over this subtotal, rather than the document's net amount. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
0No subtotal
1Progressive up until this tax
2Includes this tax only

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of a supplier credit.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of taxes to be applied (**optional**). If the document contains taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may optionally resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other taxes. You may also include additional taxes, which will be calculated based on the total net amount of the document.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding taxes to be applied. If the document contains withholding taxes that have already been applied at the line level, you may **optionally** resend them here. This will help specify the order that these taxes will have among the other withholding taxes.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

template.title: Template
template.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The template to use when rendering to PDF.

title.title: Title
title.description: A unique title for this tax.

tax_type.title: Tax type
tax_type.description:
Denote if this is a special tax. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
vatVAT
withholdingWithholding tax

value_mode.title: Value mode
value_mode.description:
How the tax value should be calculated. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
percentagePercentage
fixedFixed amount
dynamicVariable amount

operand.title: Operand
operand.description:
Controls whether this a tax (positive value) or a deduction (negative value). One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
++
--

percentage.title: Percentage
percentage.description: The tax percentage does not apply to fixed taxes, where a flat `amount` is used instead. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

amount.title: Fixed amount
amount.description: Applicable only when this is a fixed tax, in which case the `percentage` field will have no effect. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

per_unit.title: Depends on quantity
per_unit.description: Applicable only when this is a fixed tax. If selected, the tax amount is calculated by multiplying the applied document item's quantity with tax amount.

subject_to_vat.title: Subject to VAT
subject_to_vat.description: Should VAT taxes include this tax when calculating their tax amount?

apply_on_document_lines.title: Can be applied on document lines
apply_on_document_lines.description: Typically, withholding taxes are being applied on the total net value of a document. This field dictates if a withholding tax can also be applied on the line level. The field does not have any effect on taxes other than withholding taxes.

active.title: Active
active.description: Instead of deleting, you may archive the record.

created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

title.title: Title
title.description: A unique title for this tax.

title_translations.title: Title translations
title_translations.description: This applies to organizations creating invoices in multiple languages and controls the tax translations for each language.

Denote if this is a special tax. One of the following or blank (empty string):

apply_on_document_lines.title: Can be applied on document lines
apply_on_document_lines.description: Typically, withholding taxes are being applied on the total net value of a document. This field dictates if a withholding tax can also be applied on the line level. The field does not have any effect on taxes other than withholding taxes.

tags.name: Authorization
tags.description:
**Organizations** are a key concept in Elorus. Each user is assigned a role 
within an organization / company, depending on which he may or may not 
be able to perform actions. To specify the organization on which you 
wish to operate, you must provide the custom 
`X-Elorus-Organization` HTTP header:

    X-Elorus-Organization: 128759403567807

Since each API key represents a user, the ability to retrieve, update or 
delete data **depends on the user role** within the specified organization.

In the event of an unauthorized request, the Elorus API returns a `HTTP 403` 
response. Additional details about the error may be provided within the 
response body.

The use of `X-Elorus-Organization` is explicitly documented where needed,
under the *Header Parameters* section. 

To start developing with the Elorus API you need to sign up for a free account.
The best way to try out Elorus and test your code is through 
[demo organizations](#tag/Using-the-API).

tags.name: Using the API
tags.description:
## Demo organizations

While developing your application, 
it is recommended to restrict all API requests only to demo organizations 
by providing the `X-Elorus-Demo` HTTP header:

    X-Elorus-Demo: true


This way Elorus will enforce a demo organization, preventing accidental data 
loss on production organizations. Demo organizations are a special form of 
organizations, suitable for reviewing 
Elorus and experimenting with the API. Within a demo organization:

- You can create unlimited documents to unlimited clients / suppliers.
- You can only have a single user - yourself.
- User management & plan subscription functionality is disabled both in 
the application UI and the API.
- Data is automatically reset at the 1st of every month.

****
Demo organizations can be created through the Elorus UI. Contact the [Elorus 
support team](mailto:support@elorus.com) for more information.
****

## Call rate limits

Each user has a hard limit of 1000 API calls per day. 
At the same time, a user may not perform more than 60 requests 
per minute. If an API call exceeds these limits, you will receive an 
`HTTP 429` response. The accompanying error message will look like 
`"Request was throttled. Expected available in 60.0 seconds"`.

## Localization

### Language

The English language is used throughout the Elorus API, regardless 
of the authenticated user's language preference. The English
locale conventions are also used for decimal numbers and dates:

- The character `.` is used as a floating point for decimal numbers.
- Dates are expected & returned in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

### Timezone
The UTC timezone is used throughout the Elorus API. 
Datetime values are formatted in the standard ISO format.

tags.name: What's new in API v1.2
tags.description:
The Elorus Developer API v1.2 introduces new functionality that was 
previously available only through the web application, along with several 
updates aimed at simplifying API usage.

## New Features

- **Time tracking**. Manage *Projects*, *Time entries* 
and *Tasks* via the API.
- **Private notes**. Create and manage private notes for all 
entities that support this feature
(*Contacts*, *Invoices*, *Payments received* etc.). These notes are
visible only to your team.
- **Client discussions**. Clients can leave comments on any record available 
via the client portal, and you can respond to them. Starting with v1.2, 
these discussions can now be managed through the API.
- **Tax calculations**. You can now specify custom amounts for any tax 
on a document.
- **Global document taxes**. Set a list of global taxes directly 
on the document, instead of applying them to each line item individually.
- **Units of measurement**. Use custom units of measurement 
on document lines. Manage your list of custom units 
of measurement through the API.
- **Numbering sequences**. Assigning a document’s numbering sequence 
has been simplified. You no longer need to know the sequence ID.


## Migrate from API v1.1

The Elorus API v1.2 introduces a few backward-incompatible changes. 
Migrating from API v1.1 is straightforward, but here are some key 
changes you need to implement to get started:

### Assigning numbering sequences to records

Previously, to specify a record's numbering sequence, you had to set the 
sequence’s ID in the `sequence` field. This process has been simplified. 
You no longer need the sequence ID; you can now send the sequence name 
directly to the `sequence_flat` field.

For example, if you have a numbering sequence called "SEQ-A" 
with ID "123456789", assigning it to an invoice in API v1.1 
would look like this:

```
{
    "sequence": "123456789",
    "number": "1"
    ...
}
```

In API v1.2, the same action is now written as:

```
{
    "sequence_flat": "SEQ-A",
    "number": "1"
    ...
}
```

This applies to [Invoices](#tag/invoices), [Credit notes](#tag/creditnotes), 
[Estimates](#tag/estimates), [Recurring invoices]((#tag/recurringinvoices)), 
[Bills](#tag/bills) and [Supplier credits](#tag/suppliercredits).

### Setting the document taxes

In API v1.1, when specifying taxes for [Invoices](#tag/invoices), 
[Credit notes](#tag/creditnotes), 
[Estimates](#tag/estimates), [Recurring invoices]((#tag/recurringinvoices)), 
[Bills](#tag/bills) and [Supplier credits](#tag/suppliercredits),
you would send a flat list of tax IDs:

```
{
    "lines": [{
        "taxes": ["<tax_id_1", "<tax_id_2>"]
    }, ...]
    ...
}
```

In API v1.2, `taxes` is a nested structure, and you must send the 
tax ID using the `tax` key:

```
{
    "lines": [{
        "taxes": [
            {"tax": "<tax_id_1"}, 
            {"tax": "<tax_id_2>"}
        ]
    }, ...]
    ...
}
```

### Units of measurement

To set the unit of measurement for a document line, 
you now need to use the unit's `symbol` property, instead of 
the previously used fixed unit ID.

### Filtering records by sequence

If you previously used the `sequence` query parameter to search for 
records with a specific sequence ID, you now need to perform a 
search on the `sequence_flat` field using the sequence name.

For example, the old API v1.1 query
`/v1.1/invoices/?sequence=<sequence_id>`, in API v1.2 becomes 
`/v1.2/invoices/?search_fields=sequence_flat&query=<sequence_name>`.

This applies to [Invoices](#tag/invoices), [Credit notes](#tag/creditnotes), 
[Estimates](#tag/estimates), [Recurring invoices]((#tag/recurringinvoices)), 
[Bills](#tag/bills) and [Supplier credits](#tag/suppliercredits).

### Managing numbering sequences

The old numbering sequence endpoints under `/v1.1/numberingsequence/` 
are no longer available. Numbering sequences can now be managed 
for specific [Document types](#tag/documenttypes) via the
[sequence endpoints](#operation/documenttypes_sequences_list).

tags.name: contacts
tags.description:
A contact in Elorus represents a client, a supplier or both.  

#### Tracking categories
Contacts may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can be of
great use in reports. The API allows for full
control over contact tracking.

tags.name: invoices
tags.description:
An invoice holds information regarding the actual transaction
(such as the client, date, amounts etc.), as well as additional
information needed to render the document as PDF.


#### Client data
Invoices also store a copy of all the client information that will be 
displayed on the PDF. Consequently, you can modify the underlying 
client [contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g., update the billing address) 
without affecting the printed format of previous transactions with that client.


#### Payment gateways
If you want to let clients pay online, you must associate 
one or more [payment gateways](#tag/paymentgateways) with your invoices.
Each invoice may have a distinct set of payment gateways, depending
on the business needs (e.g. the client's currency or country etc.)  


#### Tracking categories
Invoices may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your sales performance. The API allows for full
control over the invoice tracking.

tags.name: creditnotes
tags.description:
A credit note holds information regarding the actual transaction
(such as the client, date, amounts etc.), as well as additional
information needed to render the document as PDF.

#### Client data
Credit notes also store a copy of all the client information that will be 
displayed on the PDF. Consequently, you can modify the underlying 
client [contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g., update the billing address) 
without affecting the printed format of previous transactions with that client.

#### Tracking categories
Credit notes may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your sales performance. The API allows for full
control over the credit note tracking.

tags.name: estimates
tags.description:
An estimate contains information regarding the actual quote, 
including details about the client, date, amounts, and more. 
It also includes additional information necessary for exporting 
the document as a PDF.

#### PDF rendering
The process of converting estimates into PDF format is performed by a 
component called [Template](#tag/templates). Templates define the design 
aspects, such as layout, color schemes, logo, as well as the content 
of the PDF, such as language and which columns to display or hide on each line.

#### Client data
Estimates also store a copy of all the client information that will be 
displayed on the PDF. Consequently, you can modify the underlying 
client [contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g., update the client's address) 
without affecting the printed format of previous transactions with that client.

#### Accepted / rejected estimates
When an estimate is sent to the client, they have the option to accept or 
reject the quote. This acceptance or rejection status is saved in 
the `accept_status` field. Additionally, the API enables you to 
programmatically mark the estimate as accepted or rejected by 
modifying the `accept_status` field.

tags.name: recurringinvoices
tags.description:
Recurring invoices serve as a template, based on which
new invoices are created automatically. The frequency 
that new invoices are generated 
is determined by a corresponding *schedule*.

#### Recurring schedule
The recurring schedule comprises four fields. The `start_datetime`
denotes the first time that a new invoice should be created. The
`interval` and `period` fields specify the frequency 
(e.g. every 2 weeks) and the `end_datetime` the date on which the
last execution will occur. For example, to create a recurring invoice
that will start on Jan 1, 2019 and will generate new invoices
every month until Jan 1, 2020, the recurring schedule would be:

~~~
start_datetime   2019-01-01T10:00:00.0Z
interval         1
period           months
end_datetime     2020-01-01T10:00:00.0Z
~~~

#### Generated invoices
Additional information regarding the generated invoices 
(i.e. the client, invoice lines, appearance settings etc.) is also
stored on the recurring invoice. Therefore, recurring invoices
have most of their fields in common with 
[normal invoices](#tag/invoices). For example, the recurring invoice's
`draft` field controls whether the created invoice will be a draft,
rather than whether the recurring invoice itself is a draft. 
To easily identify the role of each field, please see the field
description in the corresponding endpoints.


#### Tracking categories
Recurring invoices can also hold information about your 
[custom tags](#tag/trackingcategories). Once again, this 
does not categorize the recurring invoice; it dictates
the tags that will be automatically assigned to the created
invoices instead.

tags.name: bills
tags.description:
Bills typically represent invoices that you receive from 
suppliers. 

#### Bill lines
Elorus allows you to record every line of the
received invoice separately. If you do not care about the
details, you may choose to store total amounts in a single line.


#### Self-billing
Self-billing is a commercial arrangement between a supplier and a 
customer in which the customer (you) prepares the supplier's invoice 
and forwards a copy to the supplier with the payment. In Elorus, self-billed
invoices comprise a special form of bills that can be exported to a PDF, 
and must be therefore associated with a [document type](#tag/documenttypes).
To denote a self-billed invoice, the `self_billed` flag must be used.


#### Tracking categories
Bills may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your bills. The API allows for full
control over the bill tracking.

tags.name: suppliercredits
tags.description:
Supplier credits typically represent credit notes that you receive from 
suppliers. 

#### Supplier credit lines
Elorus allows you to record every line of the
received credit note separately. If you do not care about the
details, you may choose to store total amounts in a single line.


#### Tracking categories
Supplier credits may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your purchases. The API allows for full
control over the supplier credit tracking.

tags.name: expenses
tags.description:
Expenses typically represent already paid bills. Expenses may optionally
be associated with a supplier.

#### Expense lines
Elorus allows you to record every expense line separately. 
If you do not care about the details, you may choose to store
total amounts in a single line.


#### Tracking categories
Expenses may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your purchases. The API allows for full
control over the expense tracking.

tags.name: deliverynotes
tags.description:
A Delivery note contains information regarding the shipment, 
including details about the client, date, shipping address, and more. 
It also includes additional information necessary for exporting 
the document as a PDF.

To use the delivery notes functionality, the corresponding add-on 
must be installed in the organization.

#### PDF rendering
The process of converting Delivery notes into PDF format is performed by 
a component called [Template](#tag/templates). Templates define the design 
aspects, such as layout, color schemes, logo, as well as the content of 
the PDF, such as language and which columns to display or hide on each line.

tags.name: projects
tags.description:
Projects are a set of activities that lead to an agreed outcome. 
There may be one or more teammates assigned to each project, 
bound to devote their time in accomplishing different tasks.

Elorus helps you track time spent, calculate labor costs as well 
as other expenses you may have added. At the same time, rates per 
hour allow you to seamlessly invoice your clients while you can 
check how much you have spent and what you are about to make at 
any given time.

tags.name: timeentries
tags.description:
Time entries in Elorus are used to record the duration spent on specific 
tasks and projects. They help track work hours for accurate billing and 
project management. Through the API, you can create, update, and manage 
time entries, as well as retrieve data on time tracked by your team.

tags.name: tasks
tags.description:
You can use the API endpoints to create and update tasks. 
Tasks that are not linked to a specific project are considered "global" 
and can have time tracked against them in any project. In contrast, 
project-specific tasks can only have time tracked within 
their designated project.

Please note that once a task is created, its assigned 
project cannot be changed.

tags.name: cashreceipts
tags.description:
Payments received represent money that you receive in the context
of a single transaction. They can be either a client payment,
a supplier refund, other income or other payments (for more information, 
please see the Elorus documentation).

#### Tracking categories
Payments received may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your cash flow. The API allows for full
control over the payments received tracking.

tags.name: cashpayments
tags.description:
Payments sent represent money that you sent in the context
of a single transaction. They can be either a supplier payment,
a client refund or other payments (for more information,
please see the Elorus documentation).

#### Tracking categories
Payments sent may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your cash flow. The API allows for full
control over the payments sent tracking.

tags.name: products
tags.description:
This entity represents inventory items that 
your company may sell or purchase. Products / services may be
assigned to invoices, credit notes etc. and are primarily 
used to:

- View sales / purchase reports per item
- Manage inventory stock


#### Products / services in sales & purchases

In real world, products may be sold, purchased or both. 
In Elorus, you must explicitly specify whether you buy or 
sell a product: 

To be able to associate a product with an invoice or 
credit note, the product's
`sales` property must be set to `true`. 
To be able to associate a product with a bill or 
a supplier credit, the product's
`purchases` property must be set to `true`  


#### Stock management

To let keep track of the product's stock in your inventory, 
the `manage` property must be set to `true`. 
Each time the product is being sold 
(i.e. an invoice line is associated with the product) 
the stock will increase as dictated by the quantity. Each time
the product is being purchased (i.e. associated with a bill)
the stock will decrease as dictated by the quantity.

#### Tracking categories
Products / services may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and are primarily a reporting
tool: they can help you better understand your sales / purchases.

tags.name: unitofmeasurement
tags.description:
For convenience, throughout the entire API, the `symbol` property of the unit 
of measurement is utilized instead of the `ID` property for setting the 
units of products, invoice lines, etc.

Certain units of measurement, created by Elorus, are immutable and cannot 
be edited or deleted. These records are marked with their 
`protected` property set to `True`.

tags.name: taxes
tags.description:
You may retrieve the list of taxes via the API. However,
to update or create new records, the web application must be used.

tags.name: paymentgateways
tags.description:
You may retrieve the list of payment gateways via the API. However,
to update or create new records, the web application must be used.

tags.name: expensecategories
tags.description:
Expense categories enable users to classify expenses & bills. Elorus
comes with a predefined set of expense categories. Users may also
create additional, custom categories.

tags.name: trackingcategories
tags.description:
Tracking categories are primarily a reporting tool to help you
monitor the performance of all sorts of records. Think of each category
as a group of conceptually related, mutually exclusive options (tags) that
can be used to identify a record.

For example, to monitor your sales by continent, you may create a
tracking category named "Continent". The available options will be
"North America", "South America", "Europe", "Asia", "Africa", 
"Australia" and "Antarctica". Once the category is created, 
you may associate each invoice with exactly one continent.

Tracking categories can be used as filters in reports (e.g. you can filter
the results by continent), or even as groupers (e.g. you may view
your revenues per continent and calculate sub-totals).

tags.name: templates
tags.description:
Templates dictate the way that invoices, estimates, credit notes etc. will
be rendered. They hold information about the content (e.g. which columns 
to show on the line items table, whether to display the outstanding amount 
or not, etc.) and the design (e.g. colors, fonts, static texts). 
Templates may also be used to specify default messages that will
be used when communicating with your clients via email.

Each template is associated with a language. You may use multiple templates
to address international clients and issue invoices in different languages.

#### IMPORTANT NOTE

Using this API you are able to obtain the templates and inspect their
properties. However, creating, modifying & deleting templates 
is not supported.

tags.name: emailtemplates
tags.description:
The Email templates are email message presets that can be used whenever
sending an invoice, credit note etc. to a client. 
They utilize a set of predefined variables that can be 
substituted with actual invoice data upon request.

Once an email template has been created, you may use the `email` endpoint
of the corresponding entity 
(e.g. [email an invoice](#operation/invoices_email_read)) 
to retrieve the generated email message.

tags.name: documenttypes
tags.description:
Document types define distinct kinds of documents, each following a separate
numbering sequence. The most common document type is the "Invoice". If, 
for example, one needs to issue "Tax invoices" and "Retail invoices" 
separately, they would create two new document types.

Each document type applies to a specific type of records. You may create 
document types that apply to invoices, credit notes or estimates.

Finally, document types specify the translations to use when invoicing
in multiple languages.

### Numbering sequences

Numbering sequences are prefixes that define a new, unique numbering for
invoices, credit notes, estimates etc. For example, given an
invoicing sequence "A" and a second sequence "B", your invoices may look
like:
- Invoice A-1
- Invoice A-2
- Invoice A-3
- Invoice B-1
- Invoice B-2
- ...

Numbering sequences are unique to each document type.

tags.name: organizationbranch
tags.description:
Use the API endpoints to create and update organization branches.
Branches help indicate the origin of issued documents and are also
used in reports for tracking and organizational purposes.

tags.name: users
tags.description:
The developer API provides access to the list of organization users, 
but it does not permit user management or permission updates.
